conclusion: Analyzing how shadows A, B, C, and D change when the light source moves.
Blue alarm clock casts shadow A.
White device with buttons casts shadow D.
Shadows move in the opposite direction of the light source and change size based on light angle.
If the light source moves to the back left, shadow A will move toward the front right and elongate.
If the light source moves to the back left, shadow B will move toward the front right and elongate slightly.
If the light source moves to the back left, shadow C will move toward the front right and elongate significantly.
If the light source moves to the back left, shadow D will move toward the front right and elongate.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadow A will move toward the front left and elongate.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadow B will move toward the front left and elongate slightly.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadow C will move toward the front left and elongate significantly.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadow D will move toward the front left and elongate.
Final answer: Shadows will shift direction and elongate when the light source moves.
